_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:     MFA Anhydrous Ammonia Plant - Lexington

Location:    10601 Highway 224 Lexington, MO

Contact:    Ryun Morris

Phone:            660-259-2261



1. The Facility Policy



MFA Incorporated and the employees of the MFA Anhydrous Ammonia Plant near Lexington are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Lafayette County LEPC and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the buying and selling of grain and the receiving, storage and distribution of anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient.



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program



The facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K61.1, 1999", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., the Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". Currently the facility is evaluating the requirements of CGA-2.1 - 2014 and will make the required upgrades if needed. 



4. The Five-Year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past 5 years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program



   a. The facility has a written emergency action plan, in accordance with the OSHA Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38.



   b. The facility has provided State and Local Authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required

under    SARA Title III (EPCRA).



   c. Employees will not respond to any release other than to activate an emergency shut-off while evacuating the facility. Local emergency responders will be notified to control any release.



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. Currently the facility is evaluating the requirements of CGA-2.1 - 2014 and will make the required upgrades if needed.
